problems.title: Longest Common Subsequence (LCS)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given two strings S1 and S2, find the length of their Longest Common Subsequence.

A subsequence is a sequence derived from another sequence by deleting some or no elements without changing the order of the remaining elements.

This is a classic DP problem!

DP State: dp[i][j] = length of LCS of S1[0..i-1] and S2[0..j-1].
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abcde
ace

Sample Output
3

Explanation:
The longest common subsequence is "ace" with length 3.
problems.constraints:
1 <= |S1|, |S2| <= 1000
Strings contain only lowercase English letters.

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    s1 = data[0]
    s2 = data[1]
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.lcs(s1, s2))

hintsList: Create a 2D table dp[m+1][n+1]. If characters match, extend the LCS. Otherwise, take max of excluding one character.
dp[i][j] = dp[i-1][j-1] + 1 if s1[i-1] == s2[j-1], else max(dp[i-1][j], dp[i][j-1]). Answer is dp[m][n].
